result.title: Ranking Contests
result.content:
Ranking contests are important to evaluate the individual performance of participants. This is the first year we get to apply this system in FCIS ASU, but it's widely used in many universities nation wide and all over the world. This season we will have three ranking contests, and based on these three contests a rating will be generated for each participant.

The ranking contests will be held on Thursday (3/8), Friday (4/8) and Saturday (5/8) at 4 PM.

Rules

You should:

  • Start the contest with an empty project/package with no class created.
  • Stay focused through the entire 5 hour duration of the contest.

You can:

  • Use a calculator.
  • Search for a tutorial on a certain topic you already know, just to refresh your memory or as a reference.
  • Search for a code snippet for a certain algorithm or data structure as a reference.

You shouldn't:

  • Exchange ideas or codes with any other individual (even if he's not participating in the contest).
  • Copy any line of code from anywhere outside your project.
  • Search for problem specific tutorials.
  • Look at any old submissions even if it's not yours or if it's not in a problem in the contest.

Our community is built on trust, so we expect you all to follow these rules without any supervision.

I'd like to thank TsunamiNextYear, khaledkee, Ahmad_Elsagheer, Mohammad_Yasser and omarmmali for their help during the process of preparing this system and these contests.

I wish you all enjoy the contests and perform well. Good luck!
